verbs.description: vitriolize (third-person singular simple present vitriolizes, present participle vitriolizing, simple past and past participle vitriolized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, dated) To convert into a vitriol; to vitriolate.
(transitive, dated) To injure (a person) with sulphuric acid, as by throwing it upon the face.

examples: Similarly, Something for Everyone was described as “an innocent seeming piece of Bavarian chocolate that has been vitriolized by hypodermic injection.”
